physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a man. He is seated beside a table and resting his arms on the supports of the chair. He is dresssed in his ethnic costume and is looking towards the direction in which the photograph was captured.
sgcool_label_text:
This studio portrait shows a baba seated beside a table, his arms resting on the arms of the chair. 

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
title_text: Studio portrait of a seated baba
subject_terms_1: studio portraits men (male humans) Peranakan folk costume
subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Portrait photography Men Ethnic costume Peranakan (Asian people)
